title: Confucius: Education for All
description: A short lesson to help you apply Confucius: Education for All.

hook.text: In 500 BCE China, education was for aristocrats only. One teacher said: anyone who brings dried meat may learn.

buildup.text: Confucius accepted students regardless of social classâ€”a radical idea at the time.

discovery.text: He taught self-cultivation through ritual, music, and study of ancient texts. Character mattered most.

twist.text: His emphasis on memorization and respect for authority shaped East Asian education for 2,500 years.

climax.text: The imperial examination system he inspired lasted until 1905â€”the longest meritocracy in history.

punchline.text: Confucius opened the school door. Merit decided who walked through.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about Confucius's approach to education?
